newsitem.title: UK: BADMINTON-SUSANTI BOWS OUT OF ALL ENGLAND CHAMPIONSHIPS.
newsitem.headline: BADMINTON-SUSANTI BOWS OUT OF ALL ENGLAND CHAMPIONSHIPS.

text.p: Susi Susanti bowed out,
possibly for the last time, at the All England Championships on
Thursday at a tournament she virtually made her own during the
early 1990s.
The four times All England winner and ex-World and Olympic
champion found number two seed Gong Zhichao too strong, the
Chinese winning their quarter-final 11-4 11-7.
Susanti, 26, is seeded only joint fifth this year and her
days at the top level internationally may be numbered.
But she said after Thursday's defeat: "I still want to go on
for a couple of years, as long as my fitness holds."
Susanti last month married her long time sweetheart Allan
Budi Kusuma, also of Indonesia. The pair made headlines round
the world in 1992 when, as an engaged couple, they won the
Olympic singles titles in Barcelona.
Susanti first won the All England title in 1990 and followed
up with further success in 1991, 1993 and 1994.
But on Thursday her elegant game was no match for the
determined Gong who at the age of 19 looks a fair bet to lift
the title.
In Friday's semifinals she will meet unseeded South Korean
Ra Kyung-min who ousted joint third seed Camilla Martin of
Denmark in a 62-minute tussle 11-7 11-12 11-6.
The other semifinal will be between China's world champion
Ye Zhaoying and unseeded compatriot Dai Yun, the woman who on
Wednesday eliminated top seed Mia Audina of Indonesia.
In the men's singles, world champion and former All England
title holder Heryanto Arbi reached the semifinals with a
three-set victory over unseeded Chinese Luo Yigang.
A final against Olympic champion Poul-Erik Hoyer Larsen on
Saturday was looking on the cards.
There was something for the locals to cheer when English
couple Chris Hunt and Donna Kellogg reached the semifinals of
the mixed doubles, beating the joint fifth seeds from Russia
Nickoial Zuev and Marina Yakusheva in straight games.
The win was all the more remarkable as Hunt's breakfast
companion, a stranger, had collapsed and died during the meal.
Hunt was clearly unsettled during the day but recovered in time
to record the victory.
